name: electricity production, peat | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5578/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in an average peat power plant on the world in 2012.  This dataset has been extrapolated from a global 2008 dataset representing electricity production with lignite due to the lack of specific peat data.;The only exceptions are data for efficiency and emissions of SO2, NOx, particles and CO2 (see tab. 9.28 in Röder et al. 2007). These emissions were available from peat incineartion in Finland. As electricity from peat is mainly produced in Finland, Ireland, Sweden and Russia, these values were taken over for this dataset.;In this dataset, no desulfurisation and denitrification is taken into account. ;All following information are valid for lignite.;For the assessment of main characteristics (sulphur and ash content of coal, efficiency of the plant) and criteria emissions (SOx, NOx, particles, and CO2) a bottom-up approach has been used. It consists in the collection of information about single plants (in this case in Finland). ;- The size distribution of particle emissions has been derived from German data.  ;- Halogene emissions have been estimated on the basis of the content of the species in the country-specific coal input mix, assuming average retention rates. ; - For CO and particle emissions average values for the former UCTE are included (Union for the Coordination of the Transmission of Electricity, since 2009 replaced by ENTSO-E European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity).  ;  - Emissions of trace elements were calculated by means of a formula (CORINAIR) using the ash content in the country-specific coal input mix and average transfer coefficients for coal power plants, taking into account the share of DeSOx installed. ; - Emission of uranium and thorium radioactive isotopes were assumed proportional to the corresponding element emitted with particles; the other non-gaseous radioactive isotopes of the uranium and thorium decay chain were assumed proportional to the emitted U-238 or Th-232. ; - The emission of gaseous radon and K-40 are taken from the literature.;IEA. 2009. Coal information, 2009 edition. Documentation for beyond 2020 files. International Energy Agency.;European Environment Agency (1991) CORINAIR Inventory; VOC's Default Emission Factors

From the constructed lignite power plant ready to produce electricity. 

From reception of peat and operating materials at power plant gate.

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes: 
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants. 

 - Particle removal (dedusting of the flue gas)
 - Cooling: It is assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower. No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
- Loss of feed water 


This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced
 - The disposal of non-recycled ashes is modelled separately.
 - Use of fuel oil for startup, as this can be neglected for lignite power plants because these are run for a long time (2-3 years) without being shut down.
  - Desulfurisation and denitrification.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: A lignite power plant is used as infrastructure. Lignite power plant input is a dataset which consists out of a mix of 30% 100MW power plant and 70% 500MW power plant. The plants are used for basic load with 6000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plants are assumed to operate 200000 hours during its lifetime.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Data were taken over from a global dataset for electricity production with lignite except for emissions of SO2, NOx, particles and CO2 and the efficiency. No DeNOx and DeSOx is taken into account. Uncertainty was adjusted accordingly. 
Most of the exchanges were extrapolated through production-weighted averages of the datasets of the following 10 countries: AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK) (Röder et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values calculated from trace element balance, input uncertain

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Uranium-238
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Peat mass needed for producting 1kWh of electricity from peat, based on the value for burning 1MJ of peat. Value for peat in Finland overtaken for this dataset. Tab. 9.28 and Tab. 9.85 (8.8MJ/kg).

flow.name: peat
flow.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/089:Mining and quarrying n.e.c./0892:Extraction of peat

defaultProvider.name: market for peat | peat | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/089:Mining and quarrying n.e.c./0892:Extraction of peat

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Ash remaining when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and ash values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK). These values were valid for the ash being disposed off. Now, total amount of ash has been calculated (disposed+recycled) with the data in Tab. 9.69 p. 165 in Röder et al. 2007. Country ash values calculated from mass balance.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Butane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producting 1kWh of electricity from peat, based on the value for burning 1MJ of peat. Emission factors for peat burned in Finland. See tab. 9.28, p. 120 and Tab. 9.85 p. 182. Resulting particle sizes distribution for peat burning: <2.5um: 80%; 2.5-10um: 10%; >10um: 10%.  This differs slightly from the values for particle emissions in coal power plants (Tab. 9.39 p. 130) (<2.5um: 85%; 2.5-10um: 10%; >10um: 5%).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries

flow.name: Zinc II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Cooling water, decarbonised, for the cooling water circuit lost when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Röder et al. 2007, Tab. 9.65 and Tab. 9.66, p. 160f. These tables give an amount of 0.15 kg/MJ burned, which is valid for the assumption of 75% wet cooling and 25% run-through cooling. However, this revised dataset assumes 100% wet cooling.

Röder et al. 2007, Tab. 9.65 and Tab. 9.66, p. 160f. These tables give an amount of 0.15 kg/MJ burned, which is valid for the assumption of 75% wet cooling and 25% run-through cooling. However, this revised dataset assumes 100% wet cooling.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK) (Röder et al. 2007) 


Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Propane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries

Country emissions values calculated from trace element balance, input uncertain

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Radon-220
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Ash remaining when producing 1kWh of electricity from lignite, based on the value for burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and ash values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK). These values were valid for the ash being disposed off. Now, total amount of ash has been calculated (disposed+recycled) with the data in Tab. 9.69 p. 165 in Röder et al. 2007. Country ash values calculated from mass balance.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producting 1kWh of electricity from peat, based on the value for burning 1MJ of peat. Emission factors for peat burned in Finland. See tab. 9.28, p. 120 and Tab. 9.85 p. 182. Resulting particle sizes distribution for peat burning: <2.5um: 80%; 2.5-10um: 10%; >10um: 10%.  This differs slightly from the values for particle emissions in coal power plants (Tab. 9.39 p. 130) (<2.5um: 85%; 2.5-10um: 10%; >10um: 5%).

flow.name: Particulate Matter, > 10 um
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. At the moment, the lignite power plant input consists of mix of a 100MWe power plant (30%) and a 500MWe power plant (70%). 
For this calculation, 6000 load hours per year are assumed. It is assumed that a total of 200'000h is reached during the lifetime. A capacity of 500MW is taken for the calculation.
